description: First 10 hard cases for quick testing

cases.question: Which object required both hands for its first manipulation after being picked up?
cases.analysis: Requires tracking hand1/hand2 object manipulation. All models predicted 'paper' instead of 'metal-board'

cases.question: Which object was handled by both hands during the drink preparation sequence?
cases.analysis: Requires tracking simultaneous states. All models predicted 'spoon' instead of 'bottle'

cases.question: What was the last tool used before the final water spray sequence began?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection. All models predicted 'hose' instead of 'bottle'

cases.question: Which object was manipulated immediately after the first sewing sequence completed?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection. All models predicted 'thread' instead of 'scissors'

cases.question: Which tool was used after all dough kneading and adjusting sequences were completed?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection. All models predicted 'pan' instead of 'knife'

cases.question: What tool was used immediately before the bolt tightening sequence began?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection. All models predicted 'screwdriver' instead of 'paintbrush'

cases.question: What tool was used immediately after the first water-filling action completed?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection. All models predicted 'bucket' instead of 'hose'

cases.question: What object was manipulated between the two vine-cutting sequences?
cases.analysis: Requires multi-step reasoning and completion detection

cases.question: Which object was manipulated immediately after the second wire-cutting operation?
cases.analysis: Requires precise temporal sequence tracking. All models predicted 'wire-cutter' instead of 'cable'

cases.question: Which action was performed on the generator immediately after fuel was added?
cases.analysis: Requires precise temporal sequence tracking. All models predicted 'pick-up' instead of 'check'
